flavor: The hue of your soul, the voice of your spirit, the shape of your flesh are yours to decide. Be free.
stripped_text: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.
text: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.
title: Quetzal: Free Spirit

flavor: I'm through with games.
stripped_text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter

flavor:
"If you're not in position to press the advantage, you'll never gain the upper hand."
—The Playbook
stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run this turn. Trash an unrezzed piece of ice you passed during the last run you made this turn.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run this turn.
Trash an unrezzed piece of ice you passed during the last run you made this turn.
title: En Passant

flavor: Someone's trash is another's treasure.
stripped_text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
title: Retrieval Run

flavor: Surprising, how a single blocked datafeed brings the system to its knees.
stripped_text: The Corp cannot score an agenda on the same turn he or she installed it. Trash Clot if the Corp purges virus counters.
text:
The Corp cannot score an agenda on the same turn he or she installed it.
Trash Clot if the Corp purges virus counters.
title: Clot

stripped_text: 1 credit: Break barrier subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength.
text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
title: Corroder

flavor: Just don't let it bounce back up the feed to your rig.
stripped_text: Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed. Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you are accessing (even if it has no trash cost). Errata from CR 1.2
text: Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed. Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you are accessing (even if it has no trash cost). Errata from CR 1.2
title: Imp

flavor: What is another mask to those we already wear?
stripped_text: 1 credit: Break sentry subroutine.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
title: Mimic

flavor: At the code level, all ice manifests via a small number of common protocols. Security managers are kept awake by nightmares of a disgruntled sysop walking out the door with the core infosec library.
stripped_text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
title: Ice Carver

flavor: Money is like gravity, it accretes. Justice is like resisting gravity, it takes force.
stripped_text: Place 16 credits from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it. click: Take 4 credits from Liberated Account.
text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from Liberated Account.
title: Liberated Account

flavor: Destruction is forever.
stripped_text: 2 recurring credits Use these credits to trash cards.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.
title: Scrubber

flavor:
Nobles born foolish cared not for their state
I was left alone weeping
—Toghon Temur
stripped_text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
title: Xanadu

flavor: Live in the fast lane.
stripped_text: The first time you play a run event each turn, gain 1 credit.
text: The first time you play a run event each turn, gain 1[credit].
title: Ken "Express" Tenma: Disappeared Clone

flavor: Yeah. I'm thinking I'm back.
stripped_text: The first time each turn that you make a successful run on HQ, you may choose 2 cards in your heap, if able. The Corp removes 1 from the game; the other is added to your grip.
text: The first time each turn that you make a successful run on HQ, you may choose 2 cards in your heap, if able. The Corp removes 1 from the game; the other is added to your grip.
title: Steve Cambridge: Master Grifter

flavor: "I see great opportunities ahead for you."
stripped_text: Install a resource from your grip, lowering the install cost by 3.
text: Install a resource from your grip, lowering the install cost by 3.
title: Career Fair

flavor:
"Did you order the defrag?"
"...I thought you did?"
stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Derez a piece of ice.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
title: Emergency Shutdown

flavor:
"Electronic warfare, like all warfare, is based on deception."
—The Playbook
stripped_text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
title: Forged Activation Orders

flavor: "I'm not an actor, but I am a professional." —Gabriel Santiago
stripped_text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
title: Inside Job

flavor: Go outside. Work with your hands. It'll do you good.
stripped_text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.
text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.
title: Legwork

flavor: It's not what you know. It's who you know.
stripped_text: Remove 1 tag. You may pay 1 credit to add Networking to your grip instead of trashing it.
text: Remove 1 tag. You may pay 1[credit] to add Networking to your grip instead of trashing it.
title: Networking

flavor: Slippier than a buttered escargot.
stripped_text: 1 credit: Break code gate subroutine. 2 credits: +2 strength. trash: Bypass a piece of code gate ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Abagnale.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of code gate ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Abagnale.
title: Abagnale

flavor: Her touch is as cold as her heart.
stripped_text: 1 credit: Break sentry subroutine. 2 credits: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1 credit per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1[credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
title: Femme Fatale

flavor: There is no such thing as truly disconnected from the Net.
stripped_text: click: Run Archives. If that run would be declared successful, instead change the attacked server to HQ. Then, the run is declared successful. Errata from CR 1.4
text:
[click]: Run Archives. If that run would be declared successful, instead change the attacked server to HQ. Then, the run is declared successful.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.4</errata>
title: Sneakdoor Beta

flavor: They pay you for the practice run, then you do it again for the real reward.
stripped_text: When your turn begins, you may choose a server. The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, gain 2 credits. Errata from FAQ 4.0
text:
When your turn begins, you may choose a server. The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, gain 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
title: Security Testing

stripped_text: Before drawing your starting hand, look at the top 6 cards of your stack. Set 4 of them facedown, as NVRAM. Shuffle the rest into your stack. click: Add 1 card from NVRAM to your grip.
text:
Before drawing your starting hand, look at the top 6 cards of your stack. Set 4 of them facedown, as NVRAM. Shuffle the rest into your stack.
[click]: Add 1 card from NVRAM to your grip.
title: Ayla "Bios" Rahim: Simulant Specialist

flavor: My thoughts open; unbound within, unblocked without.
stripped_text: The first time each turn you encounter a piece of ice, it gains code gate for the remainder of the run. Errata from CR 1.4
text: The first time each turn you encounter a piece of ice, it gains code gate for the remainder of the run. Errata from CR 1.4
title: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman

flavor: No Diesel? No fire!
stripped_text: Draw 3 cards.
text: Draw 3 cards.
title: Diesel

flavor: No code survives contact with the user.
stripped_text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.
text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.
title: Test Run

flavor: The incoming datafeed is blunted, rendered into a soft lie our brains can understand. Seeing the Reality beyond takes dedication and practice.
stripped_text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
title: The Maker's Eye

flavor: I do not run with my tools. I run with my heart.
stripped_text: When you install Atman, you may pay X credits to place X power counters on Atman. Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 1 credit: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.
text:
When you install Atman, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on Atman.
Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.
title: Atman

flavor: I saved it to my desktop once; couldn't find the thing for a week!
stripped_text: When you install Chameleon, name sentry, code gate or barrier. Add Chameleon to your grip when your turn ends. 1 credit: Break a subroutine of the named subtype.
text: When you install Chameleon, name sentry, code gate or barrier. Add Chameleon to your grip when your turn ends. 1[credit]: Break a subroutine of the named subtype.
title: Chameleon

flavor:
"Pallas Athena sent a heron gliding down the night. They could not see it passing, but they heard its cry."
—The Illiad
stripped_text: Install Egret only on a rezzed piece of ice. Host ice gains sentry, code gate and barrier.
text: Install Egret only on a rezzed piece of ice. Host ice gains sentry, code gate and barrier.
title: Egret

flavor: A thousand puzzles with a single solution.
stripped_text: 1 credit: Break code gate subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Gordian Blade

flavor: A rising tide drowns all servers.
stripped_text: 2 recurring credits Use these credits to trash assets.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash assets.
title: Paricia

flavor: If you have something to sell, Aesop is interested in buying. The only detail he won't ask is where you got it.
stripped_text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3 credits.
text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].
title: Aesop's Pawnshop

flavor: You can hack a social network, but hard work, collaboration, and a sympathetic ear gets you there faster.
stripped_text: click: Gain 1 credit and draw 1 card.
text: [click]: Gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
title: Professional Contacts

flavor: I thought I'd feel bad about this. I don't.
stripped_text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5 credits if it was successful.
text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5[credit] if it was successful.
title: Dirty Laundry

flavor: They were off the market for years, till the Beanstalk Crisis made redundancy fashionable again.
stripped_text: 1 recurring credit Use this credit to play events.
text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to play events.
title: Prepaid VoicePAD

flavor: The best view in the system. Priced accordingly.
stripped_text: Place 3 power counters on Earthrise Hotel when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Earthrise Hotel, trash it. When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and remove 1 power counter from Earthrise Hotel.
text:
Place 3 power counters on Earthrise Hotel when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Earthrise Hotel, trash it.
When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and remove 1 power counter from Earthrise Hotel.
title: Earthrise Hotel

flavor: Service is Guaranteed.
stripped_text: The first time the Runner passes a rezzed piece of bioroid ice each turn, you may rez a bioroid, lowering its rez cost by 4.
text: The first time the Runner passes a rezzed piece of bioroid ice each turn, you may rez a bioroid, lowering its rez cost by 4.
title: Haas-Bioroid: Architects of Tomorrow

flavor: Perfection of form.
stripped_text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
title: Project Vitruvius

flavor: They only get one childhood. Make it count.
stripped_text: Place 8 credits on Marilyn Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Marilyn Campaign, trash it. Take 2 credits from Marilyn Campaign when your turn begins. Interrupt  When this asset would be trashed, you may shuffle it into R&D instead of adding it to Archives. (It is still considered trashed.) Errata from CR 1.4
text: Place 8[credit] on Marilyn Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Marilyn Campaign, trash it. Take 2[credit] from Marilyn Campaign when your turn begins. [interrupt] – When this asset would be trashed, you may shuffle it into R&D instead of adding it to Archives. (It is still considered trashed.) Errata from CR 1.4
title: Marilyn Campaign

flavor: Hello again! Back for another game?
stripped_text: The Runner may spend click to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0. Subroutine End the run. Subroutine End the run.
text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Eli 1.0

flavor: A triumph of bioroid-driven iterative design. A pity no one understands how it works...
stripped_text: When you rez Magnet, host a program on it that is hosted on an installed piece of ice. The text box of each program hosted on Magnet is blank. Subroutine End the run.
text:
When you rez Magnet, host a program on it that is hosted on an installed piece of ice.
The text box of each program hosted on Magnet is blank.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Magnet

flavor: I roar with a thousand voices, wield a thousand weapons, remember a thousand lives.
stripped_text: The Runner can spend click to break any subroutine on Ravana 1.0. Subroutine Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice. Subroutine Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice.
text: The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ravana 1.0. [subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice. [subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice.
title: Ravana 1.0

flavor: Click!
stripped_text: Subroutine Trash 1 program. Subroutine End the run.
text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Rototurret

flavor: It's not sleep. Sleep is dreams, activity, change. These are still, cold, dead.
stripped_text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
title: Archived Memories

flavor: Sometimes we at Haas-Bioroid are asked how well bioroids interface socially with human workforces. Thanks to our tireless efforts, we believe this will not be a problem in the long term.
stripped_text: Gain click click.
text: Gain [click][click].
title: Biotic Labor

flavor: Problem solved.
stripped_text: X credits, trash: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.
text: X[credit], [trash]: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.
title: Corporate Troubleshooter

flavor: The Essence of You.
stripped_text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

flavor: The payment for entry is a mere drop of blood.
stripped_text: Place 3 agenda counters on House of Knives when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.
text: Place 3 agenda counters on House of Knives when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.
title: House of Knives

flavor: We could stop disasters before they happen, murderers before they act. Surely that's worth an android's sanity?
stripped_text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
title: Nisei MK II

flavor: I cannot stay. There is something I must do.
stripped_text: Ronin can be advanced. If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "click, trash: Do 3 net damage."
text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage."
title: Ronin

flavor: A little room, full of surprises.
stripped_text: If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. If you pay 4 credits when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
title: Snare!

flavor: As the white light blazed around her, she became still. It was too beautiful. Too perfect.
stripped_text: The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered. Subroutine End the run.
text:
The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Lotus Field

flavor: The pain of its first cutting art is a test. Bleed human-red and the second attack is stilled.
stripped_text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. Subroutine Trash 1 AI program. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.
text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Swordsman

flavor: We knew we'd found this season's must-have when all twenty of the A-tier influencers refused to return the teacup alpacas.
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2 credits for each card revealed.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.
title: Celebrity Gift

flavor: Are you watching closely?
stripped_text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.
text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.
title: Trick of Light

flavor: Director Kase hung landscapes of the Hokusai facility behind their desk. The implication was wonderful for concentrating the minds of the staff.
stripped_text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
title: Hokusai Grid

flavor: Every Hour, Every Minute, Every Second.
stripped_text: The first time you create a server each turn, draw 1 card.
text: The first time you create a server each turn, draw 1 card.
title: Near-Earth Hub: Broadcast Center

flavor: Alright everyone! The rights go live in exactly fourteen days. I want merch, I want tie-ins, I want sequels! Let's go!
stripped_text: When you score License Acquisition, install and rez an asset or upgrade from Archives or HQ, ignoring all costs.
text: When you score License Acquisition, install and rez an asset or upgrade from Archives or HQ, ignoring all costs.
title: License Acquisition

flavor: Everything is data.
stripped_text: When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3. Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
title: Project Beale

flavor: Lead the market, never follow it.
stripped_text: The first effect you draw cards with each turn draws 1 more card. Interrupt  The first time each turn you would draw any number of cards, instead look at that many cards from the top of R&D. Add 1 of those cards to the bottom of R&D, then draw X cards. X is the number of cards you would have drawn minus 1. Errata from CR 1.4
text:
The first effect you draw cards with each turn draws 1 more card.

text:
Reversed Accounts can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: The Runner loses 4[credit] for each advancement token on Reversed Accounts.
title: Reversed Accounts

flavor: A moment of your time? A moment of your time? A moment of your—

text:
When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
title: Pop-up Window

flavor: The original Net pathways were free and open. An unacceptable state of affairs.

text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Tollbooth

flavor:
Space bent back. Folds on folds.
Endlessly wide. Paper deep.

text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.
title: Wraparound

flavor: They know more about you than you do.

X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.

flavor: The Coast is open for business.

text: The advancement requirement of agendas installed in this server is lowered by 1. Limit 1 region per server.

flavor: Above the Competition.

stripped_title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World
text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.
title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World

flavor: Sometimes the small fry need a little convincing to put profit over principle.

flavor: There's only one season in Oaktown: construction.

Install Oaktown Renovation faceup.

flavor: Next stop: infinity.

text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

flavor: It's amazing what people will endure for job security.

text:
As an additional cost to rez Corporate Town, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
When your turn begins, you may trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).

flavor: Target Acquired.

text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.

stripped_text: Hortum can be advanced. If Hortum has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, its subroutines cannot be broken by AI programs and resolve the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it). Subroutine The Corp gains 1 credit. (The Corp gains 4 credits.) Subroutine End the run. (Search R&D for up to 2 cards and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D. End the run.) Errata from FAQ 4.0
text: Hortum can be advanced. If Hortum has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, its subroutines cannot be broken by AI programs and resolve the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it). flavor: Each time I came back, it was bigger. And colder.

text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Ice Wall

flavor: "Don't think we don't care. We are very upset."
stripped_text: Trace 5 If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
text: <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
title: Punitive Counterstrike

flavor: The Promontorium Agarum shipyards work on a scale that would be impossible in Earthgrav.
stripped_text: Runs against this server cannot be declared successful. (This effect does not cause runs to become unsuccessful.) Limit 1 region per server. Errata from CR 1.3
text: Runs against this server cannot be declared successful. (This effect does not cause runs to become unsuccessful.) Limit 1 region per server. Errata from CR 1.3
title: Crisium Grid

flavor: Everyone bought the newest PAD. Retro styling is in!
stripped_text: Gain 1 credit when your turn begins.
text: Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
title: PAD Campaign

flavor: No runner sees the same thing. Some say it's a beast, others a man. But they all agree that it smells blue, and tastes like eternity.
stripped_text: Subroutine The Runner loses click, if able. Subroutine End the run.
text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Enigma

flavor: You don't notice, but their profits do.
stripped_text: Gain 1 credit. Gain click if you have not played another Subliminal Messaging this turn. If the Runner did not make a run during his or her last turn, you may add Subliminal Messaging to HQ from Archives when your turn begins.
text:
Gain 1[credit]. Gain [click] if you have not played another Subliminal Messaging this turn.
If the Runner did not make a run during his or her last turn, you may add Subliminal Messaging to HQ from Archives when your turn begins.
title: Subliminal Messaging
